charts.title: uops retired per cycle by CPU
uops issued per cycle by CPU

tot_line_options.desc: Based on 64*l2_rqsts.references/cycle. Peak on haswell is 64 bytes/cycle
Based on 64*l1d.replacement/cycle. Does not seem to count all l1d replacments.
Based on 64*l2_trans.all_requests/cycle. Peak possible on haswell is 64 bytes/cycle. Peak on haswell is 64 bytes/cycle.

charts.title: L3 miss bytes per cycle by CPU

tot_line_options.desc: Based on 64*offcore_response.all_requests.l3_miss.any_response/cycle. Does not seem to count all mem traffic.

tot_line_options.comment: the sq_full event counts both HT thread's cycles
tot_line_options.desc: Based on SQ stall cycles/total cycles: 100.0*offcore_requests_buffer.sq_full/cycle

charts.title: req_outstanding bytes per cycle by CPU
L3_refs bytes per cycle by CPU
L3_misses bytes per cycle by CPU

tot_line_options.desc: Based on instructions/cycle
Based on instructions/cycle
Based on uops/cycle: idq.mite_all_uops/cycle. I think the peak is 4 uops/cycle.
Based on total uop/cycle: idq.ms_uops/cycle. Peak MS uops/cycle = 4.
Based on uop/cycle: lsd.uops/cycle. Peak loop stream detector uops/cycle = 4.
Based on total uop/cycle: idq.dsb_uops/cycle. Peak dsb uops/cycle = 4.
Based on total uops/cycle: uops_issued.any/cycle. Maximum on haswell is 4 uops/cycle.
Based on total cycles/uop: cycles/uops_retired.all
Based on L2 request bytes/total_cycles: 64*l2_rqsts.miss/cycle. Peak is 32 bytes/cycle on haswell. Does not seem to count all L2<->L3 traffic.

tot_line_options.comment: the stall cycles might be per core
tot_line_options.desc: Based stall cycles due to misprediction: 100*int_misc.recovery_cycles/total_cycles
Based stall cycles due to icache misses: 100*icache.ifetch_stall/total_cycles

tot_line_options.comment: the stall cycles seems to be per core but I don't really know
tot_line_options.desc: Based stall cycles due to fill buffer full: 100*l1d_pend_miss.fb_full/total_cycles
Cycles when Resource Allocation Table (RAT) does not issue Uops to Reservation Station (RS): 100*uops_issued.core_stall_cycles/total_cycles
stall cycles due to ROB is full: 100*resource_stalls.rob/total_cycles
stall cycles due to RS is full: 100*resource_stalls.rs/total_cycles
stall cycles due to SB store buffer is full: 100*resource_stalls.sb/total_cycles
% of Cycles without actually retired uops: 100*uops_retired.core_stall_cycles/total_cycles
ratio of uops_issued.any/uops_retired.all: uops_issued.any/uops_retired.all
icache miss bytes/cycle: 64*icache.misses/total_cycles. Peak is 64 bytes/cycle.
